messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Nihonto books, eBay vs Amazon
messages.msgSnippet: Andres, I would agree. Arbitrage away. AMZN stock is -27% on the year. It could use some help! Getting squashed in a bull stock market where everything else is
messages.messageBody:
Andres,

I would agree. Arbitrage away.

AMZN stock is -27% on the year. It could use some
help! Getting squashed in a bull stock market where
everything else is going bonkers. Even Heinz "the
ketchup company" is up +24%.
We're a bit irrational. If you can make money off
it and buy a sword or two; lead the way.

Curran

> My usual rant regarding book auctions on eBay, with
> an added twist.
>
> Amazon price including shipping for new book:
> $28.36 http://tinyurl.com/pumve
> eBay final auction price plus $10 S&H: $55.00
> http://tinyurl.com/qybaa
>
> I'm blown away by people willing to spend twice what
> a book costs
> just because they're not willing to spend a minute
> doing a simple
> search. I guess their income must be way higher than
> mine. Also, I
> think I'm going to start selling books on eBay and
> then just ship
> them straight from Amazon, pocketing the difference.
>
> The added twist is that I'm sure most of these books
> on polishing
> have resulted in good blades being damaged by people
> who think it's
> as easy as sharpening the steak knives at home.
> Polishing should be
> left to professionals.
>
> Thanks for listening (reading) to my rant.
>
> Best Regards,
>
> Andres

messages.subject: Nihonto books, eBay vs Amazon
messages.msgSnippet: My usual rant regarding book auctions on eBay, with an added twist. Amazon price including shipping for new book: 	$28.36 	http://tinyurl.com/pumve eBay final
messages.messageBody:
My usual rant regarding book auctions on eBay, with an added twist.

Amazon price including shipping for new book: $28.36 http://tinyurl.com/pumve
eBay final auction price plus $10 S&H: $55.00 http://tinyurl.com/qybaa

I'm blown away by people willing to spend twice what a book costs
just because they're not willing to spend a minute doing a simple
search. I guess their income must be way higher than mine. Also, I
think I'm going to start selling books on eBay and then just ship
them straight from Amazon, pocketing the difference.

The added twist is that I'm sure most of these books on polishing
have resulted in good blades being damaged by people who think it's
as easy as sharpening the steak knives at home. Polishing should be
left to professionals.

Thanks for listening (reading) to my rant.

Best Regards,

Andres
